text.p: Connectware Inc said Monday it has appealed a decision by an arbitration panel to award $17.7 million to IMT Inc in a case regarding Kemma RPS computer monitor screens.
The company said in a statement it filed the appeal with the Texas State Court on July 3 to reverse the July 1 decision.
It said the panel exceeded its powers by granting relief to IMT that was not allowed by the contract between the two companies.
"The arbitration panel's judgment was not unanimous," it added.
The company did not explain the reasons on which the panel's decision was based and its officials were not immediately available for comment.
Kemma screens are designed to reduce or eliminate magnetic emissions from computer monitors.
Connectware, a wholly-owned subsidiary of AMP Inc in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, develops the company's new System 8000 Enterprise ATM switch.
